title.narrative: WH2-SANITATION IN COMMUNITIES & INSTITUTIONS

description.narrative: By 2021, children, families of communities and institutions (schools and FOSA) in the intervention zones, have functional and accessible sanitary facilities., which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: People living in disadvantaged areas, especially women and children and people affected by emergencies, use safe, affordable sanitation facilities and adopt good hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, children, families of communities and institutions (schools and FOSA) in the intervention zones, have functional andaccessible sanitary facilities.

description.narrative: L&39;UNICEF a favorisé le développement d’un environnement propice à l&39;assainissement rural en RCA, en renforçant l&39;approche et les capacités en matière d&39;Assainissement Total Piloté par la Communauté (ATPC). En 2021, malgré le contexte sécuritaire, avec le soutien direct de l&39;UNICEF, 55,790 personnes vivent dans 158 communautés nouvellement certifiées Fin de Défécation à l&39;Air Libre (FDAL) alors que 3,414 écoliers dans 9 écoles et 2,700 patients de 9 centres de santé ont accès à des installations sanitaires de base. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:25/01/2022
